response_parsed.title: Harden Web Backends Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a guide on how to secure and strengthen your web backend applications using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Use FastAPI's built-in features for automatic OpenAPI generation and type checking
Leverage FastAPI's security features such as input validation, rate limiting, and CORS control
Follow best practices for writing secure code, including input sanitization and user authentication
Implement HTTPS using ASGI servers like Uvicorn or Hypercorn
Keep dependencies up-to-date to minimize vulnerabilities

code_examples.code:
import uvicorn
uvicorn.run('main:app', host='0.0.0.0', port=8000, log_level='info')

version_notes: FastAPI 0.64.0 introduced type hints for API routes and improved performance
Python 3.12+ is the latest version as of October 2022, with improvements in performance, security, and usability
caveats: Ensure your FastAPI project runs on an ASGI compatible server to enable HTTPS
Always keep dependencies up-to-date to minimize vulnerabilities and take advantage of new features
